title.narrative: Women Int'l League for Peace and Freedom

description.narrative: Team 2015: Women's Political participation in 2015 Elections For this project, we will focus on governance and democracy. The aim is mainly to address the many challenges faced by Nigerian women and meet the protection needs of the women#s human rights by amplifying their voices in decision-making and leadership processes. We intend to attain this by increasing the space for women#s participation in governance, address issues of inequality; and reduce violence and discrimination against women in both private and public spheres. We hope to achieve: # Provisions of UNSCR 1325 and CEDAW on the substantive participation of women in decision making implemented in project states by 2015 # Improved integration of women#s human rights in the legislative and other policy processes/framework # Increased public awareness and empowered women organizations and other CSC#s to assert their rights # Increased visibility of Women vying for political offices in project states creating awareness on their participation, through media, town hall meetings and media. # Building a strong women#s constituency #Team 2015# project is an awareness creation project on the critical need for women to participate in the political processes in their country at different levels. The project is thus a direct response to the challenges faced by women in Nigeria in the arena of governance and democratic processes in the nation. Since women are largely absent from public for a, leadership positions and decision-making processes in Nigeria, this has had the effect of aggravating inequality and discrimination of women because lack of women in leadership positions means that their needs and concerns are not adequately addressed by various state and non-state actors. The goal of #Team 2015# is to promote the participation of Nigerian women in the various political processes at different levels, thereby, increasing the number of women participation in decision-making processes and leadership on issues affecting their lives. This we hope will influence and increase the political will of state actors to address women#shuman rights in relation to leadership, decision-making and participation in governance. The entry point for this project is aligned with the United Nations Security Council Resolution (UNSCR) 1325 and the Convention on the Elimination of All forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW). This is based on the fact that Nigeria has ratified the Resolution and the Convention, and therefore, this provides a basis for civil engagement to ensure the implementation of these political and legal instruments. These the project will focus on creating awareness, educating on women#s Thus the project will focus on creating awareness, educating on women#s human right, mobilizing a strong women#s constituency and supporting women vying for political positions. This is a second year of funding for this organization.

participating-org.narrative:
Women#s International League for Peace and Freedom (WILPF) was formed in 1915, while WILPF Nigeria, a section of WILP started operations as a WILPF #group# in 2008 and was ratified to a full Section in August 2011 at the international Congress in Costa Rica. The WILPF Section in Nigeria was initiated by Joy Ada Onyesoh (the current National President) who had been a WILPF International memberfor some years. The new Nigeria Section saw a strategic opportunity and platform to have the issues of African women, peace and security heard on a national and international level. WILPF- Nigeria was initiated, in response to a country faced with multidimensional problems related to the discrimination of women, conflicts and challenges women face as a result of being excluded from participating in peace and human rights issues because of structural, institutional, economic, religious, social and cultural aspects embedded in Nigeria#s society. WILPF provides a platform to address these challenges through peacefuland non-violent means, women substantive involvement in decision-making in the areas of women, peace and security, women#s participation in peace processes, building thecapacity of women at grassroots and national level and being part of a network of diverse women who are passionately seeking to transform the terrain of conflicts through non-violent means in Nigeria in particular, and around the world in general. WILPF Nigeria is a non-governmental organization which vision is a gender sensitive society where women human rights are recognized, accepted andenforced.
WILPF applies a holistic approach to the understanding of women rights, which resulted in four overlapping thematic areas/strategic priorities for action: Peace and Security, Democracyand Governance, Human Rights Education and Research <(>&<)> Documentation. WILPF presently have projects running in the six geopolitical zones of Nigeria. They work with local NGOs. CSO, FBOs through strategic partnerships, as well as in the rest of Africa, where they have programmes in Ghana and DRC through Section twinning programmes.
Its objectives are - to promote gender equality and the advancement of women through human rights awareness - to facilitate women's role in conflict prevention to promote democratic principles - to increase and ensure adequate knowledge on women and peacebuilding using the UNSCR 1325 - to foster sustainable development through economic empowerment of women and youths
Women's Int'l League for Peace & Fr
